lines.text: He'll be a lot quieter when that swelling goes down.
Swelling from WHAT?
That bump on your head.

[feeling his head]
I ain't got no bump on my head.

[smacking Billy Roy's head into one of the bars]
You have now!
If a woman's eyes are blue, she'll be sweet and true to you. But if a woman's eyes are green, she'll turn hot, or cold, or mean!

You won't be needing my tender care anymore You're free to go, Jess. Anywhere where the Mexican law or Mexican federales can't find you. Or any place north where the American law or the American cavalry can't run you down. You're a famous man, Jess. Don't ever forget it.
I won't.
We've got us a timetable, Gunner.
Well, call it, Vince.
Already have. Billy Roy let loose by sundown. All right get that gun down this hill until it's a quarter mile from town.
Down that hill down there? That ain't a hill, Vince, that's a cliff.
It ain't right, Vince. It ain't fair to us! One man's hanging is more better than five. I ain't gonna let you do it!
You lost your chance at me, Marcie. Girlie, I take what's warm and close.

[clicks his rifle and points it at Jess Wade as he steps out of the tavern]
Where are you going? Mr. Go-Straight Wade!
Hey, Jess! Now you should've never left me, Jess! We miss you, couldn't you tell?

[slowly responding]
I figured.
All right, Billy, see what he's got on him.

[looking and walking around Jess, laughing as he speaks]
I'd say he's got on him uh... boots... pants... some kind of shirt... some kind of hat! That's what I'd say he's got on him, Vince.

[Vince slaps Billy down]
Take out his wallet, idiot!

[yelling hysterically]
WHAT KIND OF BROTHER ARE YOU, IN FRONT OF HIM?

[yelling angrily]
WELL DO WHAT I TELL YOU!

[Jess grabs Billy by his shirt's collar as Billy first attempts to frisk Jess]
Do you own work Vince. Don't say I need to do it for you.

[clicks his gun and points it at Jess]
Look! You've been around us long enough to know that when I bad-mouth my brother I don't want to hear an echo. NOW LET HIM GO!
